newsitem.title: USA: Syratech plans merger with equity fund corp.
newsitem.headline: Syratech plans merger with equity fund corp.

text.p: Syratech Corp said Wednesday it entered an agreement with Thomas H. Lee Equity Fund III LP to merge with a corporation formed by the fund.
Syratech said its stockholders would get $32 in cash in the deal or could elect to receive a portion of their consideration by retaining stock of the surviving entity.
Syratech said it also will redeem preferred share purchase rights.
Chief Executive Leonard Florence and other Syratech executive officers have agreed to retain equity interests with an aggregate value of at least $24 million, the company said.
Syratech said it has about nine million shares outstanding on a fully diluted basis and Florence owns about 32 percent.
Thomas H Lee Co is a private investment firm in Boston.
The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of 1997.
